text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EICR Electronic Initial Case Report (eICR)
reportDate Σ1..1dateDate of the Report
reportSubmissionDateTime Σ1..1dateTimeReport Submission Date/Time
sendingApplication Σ1..1stringSending Application
provider 0..1BackboneElementProvider
identifier Σ0..*stringProvider ID
name Σ0..1stringProvider Name
phone 0..*stringProvider Phone
fax 0..*stringProvider Fax
email 0..*stringProvider Email
facilityName 0..1stringProvider Facility/Office Name
address 0..*stringProvider Address
facility 0..1BackboneElementFacility
identifer 0..*stringFacility ID Number
name 0..1stringFacility Name
type 1..1codeFacility Type
phone 0..*stringFacility Phone
fax 0..*stringFacility FAX
address 0..*codeFacility Address
patient 0..1BackboneElementPatient
identifer 0..*stringPatient ID Number
name 0..1stringPatient Name
phone 0..*stringPatient Phone
email 0..*stringPatient Email
address 0..*stringStreet Address
birthDate 0..1dateBirth Date
sex 0..1codePatient Sex
birthSex 0..1codePatient Birth Sex
race 0..1codeRace
ethnicity 0..1codeEthnicity
preferredLanguage 0..1codePreferred Language
deathDate 0..1dateDeath Date
guardian 0..1BackboneElementGuardian
name 0..1stringParent/Guardian Name
phone 0..*stringParent/Guardian Phone
email 0..*stringParent/Guardian Email
occupation 0..*codeOccupation
pregnant 0..1codePregnant
travelHistory 0..*BackboneElementTravel History
date 1..1PeriodTravel History Dates
locationFreeText 0..1stringTravel History Location - Free Text
locationCoded 0..1codeTravel History Location - Coded
locationAddress 0..1stringTravel History Location - Address
encounter 1..1BackboneElementEncounter
visitDateTime 1..1dateTimeVisit Date/Time
patientClass 0..1codePatient Class
admissionDateTime 0..1dateTimeAdmission Date/Time
dischargeDateTime 0..1dateTimeDischarge Date/Time
historyofPresentIllness 0..1stringHistory of Present Illness
reasonforVisit 0..*codeReason for Visit
problem 1..*BackboneElementProblem
dateofOnset 0..1dateDate of Onset
symptoms 0..*codeSymptoms
diagnoses 1..*codeDiagnoses
dateofDiagnosis 1..*dateDate of Diagnosis
laborder 0..*BackboneElementLab Order
laboratoryOrderCode 0..*codeLaboratory Order Code
placerOrderNumber 0..*stringPlacer Order Number
laboratoryresultcode 0..*stringLaboratory Results
labresult 0..*BackboneElementLab Result
laboratoryresultvalue 0..*stringLaboratory Result Values
fillerOrderNumber 0..*stringFiller Order Number
medicationsAdministered 0..*codeMedications Administered(list)
hospitalUnit 0..1stringHospital Unit
immunizationStatus 0..*codeImmunization Status
triggerCode 0..1BackboneElementTrigger Code
labOrderCode 0..*codeLaboratory Order Code (trigger)
labResultCode 0..*codeLaboratory Order Code (trigger)
labResults 0..*codeLaboratory Result (trigger)
diagnosis 0..*codeLaboratory Result (diagnosis)

Documentation for this format

element.definition: "Initial Public Health Case Report" standard for use in reporting from Electronic Health Records (EHR) to health departments.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name:  Electronic Initial Case Report (eICR).

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: The date on which the reporting party(e.g., physician, nurse practitioner,physician assistant, etc.), completescollection of minimum data for theeICR.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Date of the Report.
element.requirements: Used to assess timelines of eICR dataprovisioning, and other qualityassurance tasks.

element.definition: The date and time at which the EHRsystem sends the eICR data to thejurisdictional public health agency ordesignee.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Report Submission Date/Time.
element.requirements: Used to ensure timeliness of report andto identify time lags between date of thereport and when the EHR sends thereport.

element.definition: The name of the sending application.
element.requirements: Used to ensure quality and integrity ofeICR data.

element.definition: The Provider responsible for Paitent's care.
Identification code for the care provider(e.g., NPI).
element.requirements: Need provider's contact information inorder to follow up appropriately forreportable event to ensure appropriatetreatment, identify contact exposures,etc.

element.definition: The first and last name of thehealthcare provider.
element.requirements: Need provider's contact information inorder to follow up appropriately forreportable event to ensure appropriatetreatment, identify contact exposures,etc.

element.definition: The provider's phone number with areacode.
element.requirements: Need provider's contact information inorder to follow up appropriately forreportable event to ensure appropriatetreatment, identify contact exposures,etc.

element.definition: The provider's fax number with areacode.
element.requirements: Necessary to obtain additional infoduring case follow-up phase or tosubmit supplemental information.

element.definition: The provider's email address.
element.requirements: If secure email is available; used forsharing secure links to health data ifallowed by state regulations.

element.definition: The provider facility's full name, notnecessarily where care was provided topatient.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Provider Facility/Office Name.
element.requirements: Need provider's contact information inorder to follow up appropriately forreportable event to ensure appropriatetreatment, identify contact exposures,etc.

extension.valueString: 1002 Healthcare Drive Ann Arbor MI 99999 US

element.definition: The geographical location or mailingaddress of the provider's office orfacility. Address must include streetaddress, office or suite number (ifapplicable), city or town, state, and zipcode.
element.requirements: Need provider's contact information inorder to follow up appropriately forreportable event to ensure appropriatetreatment, identify contact exposures,etc.

element.definition: The facility sending the EICR.
Identification code for the facility (e.g., Facility NPI).
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Facility ID Number.
element.requirements: Need provider's contact information in  order to follow up appropriately for  reportable event to ensure appropriate  treatment, identify contact exposures,  etc.

element.definition: The facility's name.
element.requirements: Need provider's contact information in  order to follow up appropriately for  reportable event to ensure appropriate  treatment, identify contact exposures,  etc.

element.definition: The type of facility where patient received or is receiving healthcare for the reportable condition (e.g., hospital, ambulatory, urgent care, etc.).
element.requirements: Used to determine the type of care  setting in which patient is receiving  care for the reportable condition.

element.definition: The facility's phone number with area code.
element.requirements: Need provider's contact information in  order to follow up appropriately for  reportable event to ensure appropriate  treatment, identify contact exposures,  etc.

element.definition: The mailing address for the facility where patient received or is receiving healthcare for the reportable condition. Must include street address, city/town, county, state, and zip code.
element.requirements: Need provider's contact information in  order to follow up appropriately for  reportable event to ensure appropriate  treatment, identify contact exposures,  etc.

element.definition: The subject of the EICR.
Patient social security number, medical record number, or other identifying value as required or allowed under jurisdictional laws governing health data exchange.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Patient ID Number.
element.requirements: Identification and contact; jurisdicti  may select which they can receive  based on laws governing public health  data exchange.

element.definition: All names for the patient, including legal names and aliases. Must include the name type (i.e., legal or alias), first name, middle name, and last name.
element.requirements: Identification and contact.

element.definition: All phone numbers and phone number types for the patient or parent/guardian.
The email address for the patient or the patient’s parent/guardian.

extension.valueString: Home: 5101 Peachtree St NE Atlanta, GA 30302, US
2222 Home Street Ann Arbor MI 99999 US

element.definition: All addresses for the patient, including current and residential addresses. Must include street address, apartment or suite number, city or town, county, state, zip code, and country.
element.requirements: Case Assignment, analysis and  visualization, matching.

element.definition: The patient's date of birth.
element.requirements: Appropriate identification, appropriat  identification of minors, risk; Necessar  to determine patient age; matching  electronic laboratory reports (ELR).

element.definition: The patient's administrative sex.
element.requirements: Demographic reporting.

element.definition: The patient's Sex Assigned At Birth.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Patient Birth Sex.
element.requirements: Demographic reporting.

element.definition: The patient's race.
element.requirements: Demographic reporting.

element.definition: The patient's ethnicity.
element.requirements: Demographic reporting.

element.definition: The patient's preferred language.
element.requirements: Communication with Patient.

element.definition: The patient's date of death.
element.requirements: Patient follow-up and epidemiological  purposes.

element.definition: Guardian contact information.

All names for the patient’s parent or guardian, including legal names and aliases (if patient age is < 18 years). Must include name type (i.e., legal or alias), first name, middle name, and last name.
element.requirements: For appropriate contact with minors.

element.definition: All phone numbers and phone number types for the parent/guardian.
element.requirements: Contact Patient.

element.definition: The email address for the patient’s parent/guardian.
element.requirements: Contact Patient.

extension.valueString: Centers for Disease Control 1, Peachtree St South Atlanta, GA, 404-564-7865  Since JAN 1, 1993
Centers for Disease Control 1 Peachtree St South Atlanta,GA 404-564-7865

element.definition: The patient's occupation.
element.requirements: Identification of potential risk,  transmission risk.

element.definition: The patient's pregnancy status.
element.requirements: Appropriate treatment, follow-up,  appropriate for scoring/risk  ascertainment.

element.definition: The patient's travel history.
element.requirements: Risk, potential severity of action,  timeliness of action (e.g. is travel  history relevant); Prioritization and triaging.

element.definition: The period during which the patient's traveled.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Travel History Dates.

extension.valueString: 1999 to 2007 Spent 8 years in the UK during the BSE outbreak,  In the 3 weeks before NOV 9, 2016  Brazil, APR 29, 2016 to OCT 30, 2016  Nadi, FJ ,MAY 6, 2016 to MAY 15, 2016  Montreal, QC, CA, JUL 13, 2016 to JUL 15, 2016  Sydney, NSW, AU ,OCT 22, 2016 to OCT 30, 2016  1170 N Rancho Robles Rd Oracle, AZ8562, US

element.definition: Where the patient traveled to as free text.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Travel History Location - Free Text.

element.definition: Where the patient traveled to as a code.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Travel History Location - Coded.

element.definition: Where the patient traveled to as an address.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Travel History Location - Address.

element.definition: Encounter Information.
Date and time of the provider's most recent encounter with the patient regarding the reportable condition.
element.requirements: Defines when the individual may have  been ill; a point in time to which can  link other potential cases of reportable  event; necessary to ensure follow-up  within key time frames/helps triage  priority follow-up and ensure control  measures are implemented in a timely  way.

element.definition: Whether patient is outpatient, inpatient, emergency, urgent care.
Date and time when the patient was admitted to the treatment facility; e.g., hospital.
element.requirements: Key for epidemiologic investigation -  important to know if hospitalized for  severity of condition and to triage  priority follow-up.

element.definition: Date and time when the patient was discharged from the treatment facility; e.g., hospital.
element.requirements: Key for epidemiologic investigation -  important to know if hospitalized for  severity of condition and to triage  priority follow-up.

extension.valueString: Persistent Cough REPORTED starting on 2016/10/05Whooping Respiration not reportedParoxysms Of Coughing REPORTED starting on 2016/11/04Post-tussive vomiting not reported
Presented with history of  fever, rash annd joint pain for last 4 days.  Travelled to Brazil on vacation  2 weeks prior to onset of symptoms

element.definition: Physician’s narrative of the history of the reportable event. Information about possible contacts and/or exposures may be captured here.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: History of Present Illness.
element.requirements: Indicator of reportable condition - mos  important descriptor of condition/  epidemiologic information - supports  epidemiologic investigation;  epidemiologic relevant information.

extension.valueString: Fever, rash, joint pain for several days for several days

element.definition: Provider’s interpretation for the patient’s visit for the reportable event.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Reason for Visit.
element.requirements: Indicator of reportable condition - mos  important descriptor of condition/  epidemiologic information - supports  epidemiologic investigation.

element.definition: Signs and Symptom information.
The date of symptoms for the reportable event.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Date of Onset.
element.requirements: Helps determine possible exposure and  illness- calculate incubation period.

extension.valueString: Symptom Dark stools (finding)Complaint Paroxysmal cough (finding)

element.definition: List of patient symptoms (structured) for the reportable event.
element.requirements: If clinical symptoms signify a case of  PH importance - confirm the need for  PH follow up.

element.definition: The healthcare provider's diagnoses of the patient's health condition (all).
element.requirements: Would include something that is  potentially reportable.

mapping.map: for $i in entryRelationship/observation[templateId/@root='2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.22.4.4' and code/@code = '29308-4'] return string-join(($i/value/@*, '  '),' ')

element.definition: The date of provider diagnosis.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Date of Diagnosis.
element.requirements: Knowing when patient is diagnosed;  integral to epidemiological investigation.

element.definition: Lab Order information.

extension.valueString: CBC W Auto Differential panel in BloodBordetella pertussis Ab [Units/volume] in SerumBordetella pertussis [Presence] in Throat by Organism specific culture

element.definition: Ordered tests for the patient during the encounter.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Laboratory Order Code.
element.requirements: Some lab test orders are reportable for  suspected cases.

element.definition: Identifier for the laboratory report from the encounter.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Placer Order Number.
element.requirements: Potential value to linking electronic  laboratory reports to case reports.

element.definition: Lab Result Information.

element.definition: Laboratory Result Values for the patient during the encounter.  This is the actual result values E.g., for the Bordatella pertussis by PCR this value would be 'detected' , 'not detected' or 'inconclusive'.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Laboratory Result Values.
element.requirements: Some Laboratory Results are reportable for suspected cases.

element.definition: Identifier for the laboratory order from the encounter.
element.comment: CSTE Element Name: Filler Order Number.
element.requirements: Potential value to linking electronic  laboratory reports (ELR) to eICR.

element.definition: List of medications administered for the reportable event.
element.requirements: To find treatments that were  prescribed; prophylaxis; knowing if the  patient has already been treated, lower  on the list for PH (priority).

element.definition: Laboratory Result Values for the patient during the encounter.  This is the actual result values E.g., for the Bordatella pertussis by PCR this value would be 'detected' , 'not detected' or 'inconclusive'.
